Reviews.Title: “Excellent value for its location”
Reviews.Author: steven_nagoya
Reviews.Content: I stayed there in 2007, which seems to be a life-time ago. I wanted to stay at the Royal Overseas League due to its heritage and location. It definately gives the guest a feeling of "belonging" to a club. Its location near Green Tube Station and Buckingham Palace, which not being over-pricy, makes this hotel an excellent place for those on holiday. It is not, however, a great place for business travelers. The internet access was very limited at the time of my stay. On brighter topics, the front staff were helpful when I arrived early. They allowed for me to take a shower while I waited for my room to be prepared. I would call that excellent service! The breakfast meal was pretty good and acceptable. The hotel is old, and gives off that "traditional" feeling while not looking terribly out-dated. To be a member, there is a yearly subscription fee. Definately look at staying here if you're going to be in London for more than 3 days, as the savings in the room cost will pay for the yearly membership fee.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable living in central London”
Reviews.Author: irishkiwi_8
Reviews.Content: The Royal Overseas League (ROSL) is very centrally located near St James Place close to the Strand, Buckingham Place, and the Thames River which are all within easy walking distance. The check-in was efficient and welcoming. We had booked a room for four nights with a garden view overlooking Green Park. The room which was on the top floor was spacious and comfortable. The bathroom was also spacious and well equipped. There was a large flat screen TV on the wall which unfortunately had the volume preset to captions and was very loud (for the hard of hearing I think) when first switched on but could be further adjusted with the remote. The internet was free and involved plugging in an ethernet cable into the laptop. The room also had tea and coffee-making facilities together with shortbread biscuits which were generously replenished each day. A continental breakfast was included with cereals, pastries, fruit and toast; a cooked breakfast menu was also available at an extra cost. This dining room also served an evening meal which was good value too. The hotel has an olde world atmosphere and has a comfortable reading room on the first floor which had all the London dailies available to read. The porters were very helpful and went out of their way to arrange taxis. Next time we are in London, we will stay at ROSL again.

Reviews.Title: “Mayfair location at a bargain price”
Reviews.Author: Joseca80
Reviews.Content: Rooms are small but well equipped.Need to install wi-fi access however(available in lobby).We always take a Green Park view room. Lovely staff (mostly Polish).Good restaurant at a reasonable price. The public entrance,bar lobby etc, really however need improving.Very tired feel and look (you get used to it after a while).The Club celebrated its 100th anniversary in 2010. It is in a wonderful location just a short walk to Buckingham Palace,Hyde Park,Piccadilly Circus,Bond Street,Fortnum & Mason,Hatchards,Pall Mall,St.James's Park etc.Very quiet cul-de-sac next to the posh St.James's Club. Very good value overall.Lovely garden for lunch and tea.

Reviews.Title: “Great service but poor public areas”
Reviews.Author: Bordering
Reviews.Content: This is a fine stay in London with great staff and a really good restaurant with very reasonable prices. It is crying out for someone with an eye however. The furnishing with the exception IOC the5th floor bedrooms is depressing and certainly fails the live up the the intrinsically fine building. The bar is sad and yet with only a little effort could be fabulous The Drawing room is like my elderly Aunt's was in the 1950s - simple linen loose covers and a few bits of Georgian furniture would make an enormous difference. Sorry to moan but this place could so easily go from good to great!

Reviews.Title: “An excellent venue in central London”
Reviews.Author: Yanmike
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from three nights at the League. We had an excellent room overlooking the Eye, Parliament and Westminster Abbey. Good beds, a warm room and really hot water. Lots of hanging and storage space and a safe. Great location...only a few minutes walk from Green Park tube station via the stepped short-cut into the next street. Food at the League is good but there are restaurants in the area and a Pizza Express a short walk away. It was handy to have several rooms to relax in rather than the normal foyer seating hotels provide.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location and good value”
Reviews.Author: cedub
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for three nights and found the rooms comfortable and the continental breakfasts good value. Staff were helpful. Location is brilliant.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous value and friendly”
Reviews.Author: bos77bruins
Reviews.Content: Fabulous value accommodation in London. The staff are very friendly and attentive. The food was excellent. We sat out on the terrace overlooking the park. What a beautiful location. I am looking forward to staying here again next month.

Reviews.Title: “A very english institution with comfortable accomodation”
Reviews.Author: slj60
Reviews.Content: For the price of Â£170 per night including breakfast and VAT for a room overlooking Green Park, The Royal Overseas League deserves 5 stars. I have stayed here twice now, once with a city view room (which was a little cheaper) and for the location, possibly the best in London, this is a real bargin. The club itself is rather old fashioned and the public areas are comfortable but in need of a refurbishment. The bar is very tired as is the breakfast room but both have a faded elegance that is endearingly English. The prices in the bar are a fraction of the price of the Ritz next door and afternoon tea was just as good. Tea was served in the Lounge on the first floor which is lovely but expect to see someone resembling your great aunt fast asleep in one of the armchairs. The bedrooms have recently been refurbished and are very comfortable with good quality bedlinen, free wifi,and small but modern bathrooms with good showers. For the price and the location, it's hard to better.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable club with very helpful and friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: painter2808
Reviews.Content: Very homely and comfortable place though trifle shabby in parts. Had room overlooking park but it was small and did not have much view of the park. However the club has a very friendly atmosphere and the location is absolutely superb. The staff are extremely friendly too and appear to have been there for years. The reciprocal facilities offered with other clubs around the world are simply superb. Food in buttery good. Did not try restaurant.

HotelInfo.Name: Royal Over-Seas League
HotelInfo.Address: Over-Seas House | Park Place,, London SW1A 1LR, England
